name: Amari Vice
description: I am pretty happy so far with this device using Linux. All function keys work as expected. I have not set up a way to rotate the screen when used in tablet mode as I don't ever use it this way. It is a cute gimmick but I would have been fine with a traditional laptop hinge. The only bit of advice is that you will be wise to use an OEM kernel (for Ubuntu/mint) makes support for the display drivers and brightness function keys work properly. Beyond that, it was a painless install and I am pleased with the performance for a general-purpose laptop.

name: Cameron Mabry
description: Only had this unit for a couple weeks, but so far so good. Light, powerful, feature-packed EVO-certified. This model ( UX363EA-AS74T) includes an Intel Evo Platform Core i7-1165G7 CPU, Intel Iris Xe, 16GB RAM, and a 1TB SSD (M.2 NVMe™ PCIe® 3.0 Performance SSD). It has HDMI and USB Type-A ports and two Thunderbolt 4 USB-C ports with Power Delivery and DisplayPort support. Only thing missing is a finger print reader but face recognition is supported. Near the end of initial setup process was an option to upgrade to Windows 11 Pro which I accepted.

name: Fabian Rich
description: I wanted a replacement for my laptop/tablet. I have been using a Lenovo miix 700, since 12/16! This thing is a beast. Not a powerhouse, by any means, but I carried it with me daily, and it runs everything I needed it to (office, internet browsing, music, etc.) Just recently, I noticed that the battery life is significantly shortened.

name: Kobe Luker
description: I am pretty happy so far with this device using Linux. All function keys work as expected. I have not set up a way to rotate the screen when used in tablet mode as I don't ever use it this way. It is a cute gimmick but I would have been fine with a traditional laptop hinge. The only bit of advice is that you will be wise to use an OEM kernel (for Ubuntu/mint) makes support for the display drivers and brightness function keys work properly. Beyond that, it was a painless install and I am pleased with the performance for a general-purpose laptop.

name: Steven Urias
description: I wanted a replacement for my laptop/tablet. I have been using a Lenovo miix 700, since 12/16! This thing is a beast. Not a powerhouse, by any means, but I carried it with me daily, and it runs everything I needed it to (office, internet browsing, music, etc.) Just recently, I noticed that the battery life is significantly shortened.

name: Krich Lufian
description: Overall, it's self-evident how cheaply manufactured this was, which is unacceptable for the price. The tech specs were decent for the price, but the poor overall design prevents this from being useful to me at all. I expect this would fall apart in under a year if I didn't return it.

name: Grace Dame
description: Bestes Book ever, leider ohne Umlaute weil aus den USA, aber ein super schnelles Book mit langer Akku Laufzeit und schnellem Ladevorgang. Große NVMe mit 1TB und 16GB RAM, Superbrilliante LED Grafik ein Spitzengerät.

name: Jared Salter
description: Overall, it's self-evident how cheaply manufactured this was, which is unacceptable for the price. The tech specs were decent for the price, but the poor overall design prevents this from being useful to me at all. I expect this would fall apart in under a year if I didn't return it.

name: Kade Lam
description: Me gusta que pesa muy poco, tuve una vivobook y era muy cansada de transportar, es más pequeña que las notebook promedio pero te acostumbras al tamaño de la pantalla aunque creo que debería ser mas proporcional.

name: Evan Hawlett
description: I likee Asus as a brand they make excellent products , however this one just did not work out for me . The screen developed Ghost/phantom touching esentially moving and clicking the cursor all over the screen without user imput rendering it compleaty unusable. No amount of updates or resets would fix the issue. Asus offered to fix by having me send it in for repairs. Since it was only a week old and still covered by Amazons refund policy I ended up returning it and buying a ROG zephyrus duo instead . Aside from the display issue the device also gets hot fast . Prehaps it was just me being unlucky but I did not have enough confidence to replace it for the same mode

name: TanJiv Jinnah
description: I purchased the computer with 1 tb SSD and 16 gb ram a month ago. I think the performance is good, and the picture is good. I am mostly happy with the computer. The battery life is very good. I don't really like the keyboard very much, and I don't think it is very comfortable to type on. The touchscreen attracts a lot of fingerprints, so the screen requires frequent cleaning. I am submitting the review so that asus will give me a warranty extension.

name: Bhadur Biplob
description: Lightweight, great build, wonderful built-in Asus features. Fits the hardware requirements for running media editing software like Davinci Resolve, Adobe Premiere Pro etc. Only wish there was a black Intel option.
